intro: Ageratina bimatra, commonly known as the whiteflower ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators. Ageratina bimatra prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for garden landscapes.
